description.response_time: Order Response Time Report shows the time required [duration] from when an order is received until it is processed, shipped, and received. The time required is calculated as the average from one stage to the next in a single order.
description.order_difference: Order Difference Report compares the quantity/number of doses at each stage of the ordering process. The stages in the ordering process are: order, recommend, allocate, ship, and receive.
description.consumption_supply: Receiption and Distribution compare the quantities received by the entity [receipt] and the doses issued [distribution].

response_time: Average time from order to recommendation: Average duration from when an order is created by a customer to when it is recommended by a provider.
Average time from recommended to allocated: Average duration from when the order is recommended to when it is allocated by the provider.
Average time from allocated to shipped: Average duration from when the order is allocated to when it is shipped by the provider.
Average time from shipped to received: Average duration from when the order is shipped by the provider until it is received by the customer.
order_difference: New Order: comparing the quantity/number of doses ordered by the customer with the quantity recommended by the system [to restore the stock to its maximum level].
Recommendation: comparing the quantity ordered by the customer with the quantity recommended by the provider.
Shipping: comparing the quantity ordered by the customer with the quantity shipped by the provider.
Receiption: comparing the quantity shipped by the provider with the quantity received by the customer.
consumption_supply: Receiption includes all types of receipts such as receipts from distribution, transfers from other entities, and returns from customers.
Distribution includes all types of issuances such as distribution, transfers to other entities, returns to providers, and consumption.
